caption:
This photograph features a close-up view of a textured, rugged surface that appears to be mud or clay, deeply ridged and cracked, suggesting that it might be a dried-up riverbed, lakebed, or coastal mudflat. The texture is intricate, displaying a network of crevices, bumps, and patterns that give it a chaotic yet natural structure. The lighting is dramatic, emphasizing the depth and contour of the surface, with reflections suggesting that there are still moist areas or possibly a light covering of water present. This creates a glistening effect on many parts of the mud, especially in the crevices, adding a visual contrast between the wet and dry areas.

The colors in the image are monochromatic, dominated by dark browns and hints of black in the deeper sections of the mud. There's a natural abstract quality to the photograph, rendering it almost like a textured painting. There are no visible human activities, animals, or plants within the scene; it's solely focused on the natural earthy texture and the interplay of light and shadow.

Overall, the composition isolates and magnifies a segment of the natural world, encouraging a focus on the detail and beauty found in the often overlooked nooks of environmental landscapes.
title: The Puyallup River has been contaminated by industry.
